pullRequest.body:
These are mostly transferred directly, except for `continuousAt_logb_iff` which needs different handling since it's not always true.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

### PR summary [c354630f29](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18621/commits/c354630f29bf63f9ca210cd7790b0511d1ac634a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ _root_.Finsupp.logb_prod`
`+ continuousAt_logb`
`+ continuousAt_logb_iff`
`+ continuousOn_logb`
`+ continuous_logb`
`+ continuous_logb'`
`+ logb_nat_eq_sum_factorization`
`+ tendsto_logb_nhdsWithin_zero`
`+ tendsto_logb_nhdsWithin_zero_of_base_lt_one`
`+ tendsto_logb_nhdsWithin_zero_right`
`+ tendsto_logb_nhdsWithin_zero_right_of_base_lt_one`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

@b-mehta sorry for being lazy and not checking the `log` results. I'm happy with this now, especially since there will be a follow-up PR.

bors merge

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11781424166/job/32814207832)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11782316026/job/32817067442)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11782316026/job/32817068143)
Should x become explicit now?
Good point!

```suggestion
theorem logb_pow (b x : ℝ) (k : ℕ) : logb b (x ^ k) = k * logb b x := by
```

Do you really want this as a `continuity` lemma? I would suggest marking it `fun_prop` instead, but I don't see that as being particularly useful either. I simply suspect that this is never going to be useful as a continuity lemma. 
```suggestion
```
I kept the `continuity` tag to mimic how it's done for `Real.log`. Would you prefer me to introduce a series of inconsistencies here?

Oops, I just noticed you also suggested making the change there too! I'm testing to see what breaks if we remove it, and will check back here afterwards. I'm inclined to agree the tag in both places is useless, but let's see. That said, it could be nice as a discoverability tool - it's not like this is gonna slow down `fun_prop` a lot, but if someone happens to be in the case where they really are working with functions to/from `{ x : ℝ // 0 < x }`, then having `fun_prop` do this automatically does seem valuable.
Seems to work! Let's go for it :)

```suggestion
```

If you write this in compositional form this would be a nice `fun_prop` lemma. That is:
```lean
theorem ContinuousAt.logb {f : α → ℝ} {x : α} (hf : ContinuousAt f x) (hx : f x ≠ 0) :
    ContinuousAt (fun y ↦ logb b (f y)) x :=
  sorry
```
Of course, this probably also applies to `continuousAt_log`

This is one of the lemmas I haven't transferred yet in this PR, it'll be in the next PR in this series. `ContinuousAt.log` exists, and is a `fun_prop` lemma, but for ease of review I decided to separate it out.

As I argue above, I suspect this is not useful (but I'm happy to be proven wrong).
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```
I didn't check. What's still missing?

Could you clarify your question? The remaining lemmas can be found in the referenced file; I have only changed this comment to follow the file rename. Would you like me to list all of the missing lemmas?
No, sorry, I shouldn't have been lazy. My apologies.

```suggestion
-- TODO add other limits and continuous API lemmas analogous to those in Log/Basic.lean
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(SpecialFunctions/Log): transfer results from log to logb
